chargeHist.descr: Hit and Run-Involve Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa L Lackas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run-Involve Great Bodily Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.
Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes:
**AMENDED 2/9/17: Defendant must pay jury fees**
Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must pay all outstanding jury fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  Do not drive unless properly licensed. Mental health assessment.   Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.  Firearm warning given.

timeConds.notes: Serve 30 days with huber for employment. Balance to be stayed and used at agent's discretion.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victims, PJ, DNH and ELH (person, property, residence or family). You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
